intro: Monnina tristaniana var. robusta, commonly known as the Tristan's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its habitat. It has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
